title: Flipped Learning-Based Advanced Social Education Course Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Customized education for current practitioners to enhance job competencies. Offline sessions focus on discussions and case analyses; online sessions provide pre-learning materials.

learning_goals: Learners complete at least 80% of two video lectures per week using the flipped learning model
Learners participate 100% in discussion activities based on pre-learning content during offline classes

At the end of a 4-week course, learners will analyze three advantages and two disadvantages of flipped learning, submit a 450–550-word report (introduction-analysis-conclusion structure), and achieve a grade of 'B' or higher in four of the five rubric evaluation criteria.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
